question:
Which of the following are the functions performed by Chief Vigilance Officer (CVO)?
1. Collecting intelligence about corrupt practices of the employees of his organisation.
2. Investigating verifiable allegations reported to him.
3. Processing investigation reports for further consideration of the disciplinary authority concerned.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Some of the functions performed by Chief Vigilance Officer (CVO) include: (1) He collects intelligence about corrupt practices of the employees of his organisation, (2) He investigates verifiable allegations reported to him, (3) Processing investigation reports for further consideration of the disciplinary authority concerned etc.
